Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel.......”
Reviews.Author: Erica H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It looked like nohing fancy from outside. Inside was well decorated. Rooms were smaller than normal. Had many problems at this hotel. We started off the first day with leaving the room around 9 am and returning around 4:30, the room had not been cleaned. The second complaint was that we tried to go swimming and the water was freezing cold. My children, husband and I couldn't even swim for more than 2 minutes. The next day breakfast was horrible. Runny eggs, hard bacon. Yuck!!! That night when we returned we decided to order food from fliers that were placed under door. That was a SCAM!!!! WE waited for over an hour and then we finally got our food from A TASTE OF ITALY. The order was wrong and the brought us a pizza in a Little Ceasars pizza box. We tried to get refund but ever recieved one. The hotel staff said they would they to get us our refund so they placed a huge order over the phone. The man at front desk said I will call you when they come back, but as we were getting on the elevator, he called and canceled the order speaking spanish. That night we did't even eat dinner because it was already so late. We didn't even sleep the night either because people were arguing on our floor and car alarms were going off. Trying to check out was a nightmare as well. Elevators were down. We had to wait at least 30 minutes to take our luggage downstairs. Would not reccomend this hotel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Ledrak
Reviews.Content: There's no way this hotel should be in the list of the top 10 best hotels in Miami. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice hotel, but it's definitely overrated! It's hard to access, the parking is very limited, check-in could be quicker, the meal I had in the restaurant was nothing spectacular... and I should mention one of the only 2 elevators just happened to go out while I was staying there. That was a major inconvenience; especially considering there were no stairwells that I could find to access my floor quicker. I could go on... Bottom line it's a nice hotel (good, but certainly not great). I'd stay there again, but by no means was I overly impressed by anything. It's definitely overrated on this site. I'd give it 3.75 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin713
Reviews.Content: We just checked out after spending 3 nights here and it was great! The room and bathroom were spotless and seemed to be recently renovated. The bed was incredibly comfortable and spacious. The staff was friendly every time we came in and out and they keep the building safe as they lock the doors at night and you have to swipe your key to gain entry. The only complaint was that our server at dinner didn't provide the greatest service and left us without refills or real customer service but the manager (I think that's who it was) made up for it by checking on us. I would definitely stay again! It's only about a 10 minute, easy drive to University of Miami which is also convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenience for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: inthegarden
Reviews.Content: I got the free hotel shuttle from the airport and waiting only 5 minutes. The driver was very informative about the area. There was no bell hop. But there is a luggage cart you can use, There is a large Publix supermarket about 4 block away. It has great prices and a excellent selction of wine and beer. Across the street from Publix is a CVS. There is also a Walgreens 8 block away. We found that Publix had better prices on water, soda drinks etc. than Walgreens. There is a Pizza Hut with walking distance. For breakfast there was numerous pastries like donuts, bagel etc. There various breads. And there was four types of cut fruit. Porridge and yogurt were also offer with the breakfast buffet. Hot items were French Toast fingers, Sausages, Scrambled Eggs, Bacon, Biscuits and Hash brown Patries. We took the cruise shuttle which left the hotel at 11:00 pm and go us to the port by 11:30 am .The shuttle run at 11:00, Noon and 1:00 pm. The check out counter was busy so start your check at 10:30 am. The cost was $10.00 per people.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay post-cruise”
Reviews.Author: lawgrrl52
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate thru Hotels.com, but would've been good w/o 40% discount. Clean, well-laid out, comfortable. Publix Market 1/2 mile away and Latin Cafe Cuban up the street. Convenient to everything. The staff checked our bags even though our room wasn't ready, allowing us to drive around Miami w/o worry of losing our luggage to a break-in. We will look for this property again--our best stay yet in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.. Clean and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JocelynG1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel pre and post cruise. Must admit for all the bad i have read about the hotel I was a bit nervous about staying here but we decided we would stay anyway and find out for ourselves. Had no complaints at all, check in was quick and efficient and the rooms were beautil and very clean. Post cruise we got to the hotel around 10:30 am and were told that our room was not ready and should be ready between 1 and 2pm which was find by us as we just went and hung out by the pool and enjoyed the last bit of sun., Not even an hour later the front desk manager Arnold came out and told us that our room was ready and he checked us in and got our luggage out of storage for us, we were in the room by 11:45am. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good clean place to stay and we walked around the hotel and it was safe and did not feel like we were indanger at all. Not much to eat around the hotel but we just went to burger king and ordered in pizza. Very good experience and would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Had a WONDERFUL stay at this beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luving2cruise
Reviews.Content: We booked online with Priceline and booked a King size room. We stayed there for one night post cruise. This is a beautiful new hotel! We finished our cruise at around 9:00am and left the port with friends in a taxi to go to the airport. They were flying home immediately and we went along for the ride. We called the hotel and they said the shuttle would be there shortly. It arrived about 10 minutes later. There were already a bunch of other guests and their luggage in the shuttle. After a short 10-15 minute ride, we arrived at the hotel. Arnold, at the front desk, checked us in. He is a very pleasant and friendly young man. Very professional and efficient. Since we arrived rather early, before the official check-in time, he informed us that the rooms were not quite ready. He offered to store our luggage for us and said that he figured a room would be available in about an hour. We decided to sit outside by the pool where we enjoyed a pleasant conversation with a family that was also waiting. Arnold came to find us less than an hour later and told us that a room was ready for us. This was wonderful service! He completed the check-in process and we were in our room by 11:30. The room was AMAZING! The decor is modern and comfortable. It was a beautiful, clean room with modern fixtures and accessories. There was a HUGE flatscreen LG TV. The air-conditioning was quiet and steady. There was a fridge and a microwave in the room along with a small safe. The bathroom was gorgeous! Granite countertops. Brushed nickel faucets and towel bars. I felt like I was living in the proverbial 'lap of luxury'- straight out of a designer magazine!! Since we had some time, we decided to take the city bus that goes down Flagler St. to visit downtown Miami. The bus picked us up about one block east of the hotel. It should be noted that the city bus costs $2. per person but will not give change.( ie. If you put in a $5. or $10. bill for 2 people, you will not get change.) So make sure you take some $1. bills along. The bus took us all the way to the downtown where we got off close to the government buildings. We then caught the FREE metro mover that has a terminal in the government building and toured the city from the elevated ride. (We just asked the locals how/where to access entry) We got off the metro-mover at Bayside Park and had a wonderful time strolling through the park and the adjacent shopping center. It was a Saturday afternoon and there were lots of interesting sights to see and good food, music and drinks to enjoy. After about 3 hours, we boarded the free metro-mover again and toured to the Omni station and back just for the fun of it. We got off the metro mover at the Government Buildings stop and took the Flagler St. city Bus #11 back towards the hotel. We got off at 37th St. to buy some snacks at the Publix grocery store on Flagler. After buying our munchies, we walked the few blocks back to the hotel (on Flagler by 42nd). We felt totally safe throughout our excursion and met some interesting people. When we got back to the hotel, we printed out our flight tickets for the following day on the hotel's complimentary computers. We noticed that people were eating dinner in the hotel restaurant and it looked very inviting. However, having just finished our cruise, we were not in need of an other large meal and we were content to stick with our few munchies as we watched some TV later in our room. In the future, I think we would possibly choose to eat at the restaurant since the ambience was delightful. Candlelight, flowing water-fall wall scape, just lovely... and romantic! We slept well and arrived in the lobby at 6:30am to catch the 7:00 shuttle for the airport. The shuttle driver was right on time and brought us, and 2 other families, safely to the airport. Our flight was scheduled for 8:30 and we had plenty of time. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again in the future. Danki and Pabien to Arnold for helping to make our stay completely dushi!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice one night stay -”
Reviews.Author: teach659
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we got a great rate with Priceline - we are staying two different nights, at the beginning and end of our trip. After our first stay, this is my report - I would agree that the front staff needs a little more training - our keys to our room, when it was 11:00pm and we were tired from traveling wouldn't work. This meant my husband had to go down, get in line and wait again to get this issue fixed. The check-in clerk didn't even apologize. That being said - the rooms were great for what we paid - going rate is twice that and I would have felt a little gouged for that amount. Our only complaint was the bathroom - which was new and clean but adequate only for one person who didn't need counter space. For two of us, it was quite crowded. The shower was floor level and the water poured out into the main floor. My husband had trouble handling the European type hand held shower. He suggested I put down the toilet seat for counter space. These are our only comments - for our purposes, the hotel was quite satisfactory except for the bathroom, which on an extended stay, would have been very inadequate for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and confortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickyrestrepo
Reviews.Content: For short stays in miami it is a very good place to consider....reasonable rates, close to many interesting places.... would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant and comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: mepcp85
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We booked a night at a 2queen-size bed room. The room is very cosy, extremely clean and neat. The beds are quite comfortable and new! The appliances in the room were high quality and all working. The restaurant is GREAT and very cheap. The food is amazingly seasoned and the restaurant staff is welcoming. The note staff in general was very efficient, polite and helpful. The hotel offers a shuttle from and to the airport, at no extra cost. A bad point was that we waited over an hour at the airport to get the shuttle to the hotel and we could not, because the shuttle just didn't show up. So we had to get a cab. As for the location, it is very close to the airport. Other than that, I firmly and repeatedly recommend this hotel. Since I had the opportunity to stay, in the same trip, at other hotels in Miami, much more expensive and supposed to be much fancier, I can say that Best Western Premier was a good surprise and made me wanna stay a little longer. I hope you al enjoy it as I did!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place...staff needs some supervision”
Reviews.Author: Middle_Aged_Man
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice airport MOTEL. (Let's face it, anything that is a rectangular block of rooming units surrounded by parking lots is a motel, not a hotel. This is a nice one though--good sized rooms, very well decorated and appointed ....as are the public areas. The staff is very friendly, but they really need some supervision. They do not seem to be oriented toward the customer as much as they should be. Service was VERY slow in the restaraunt and bar and twice patrons had to ask the bartender "Are you going to serve me my drink?" after the bartender stopped to huddle and talk for a long time with other staff. In fact, that seemed to be a pattern with the staff--they would gather together in little groups and converse instead of tending to the chores at hand. If they get that straightened out, this will be a nice motel. P.S. The food in the rest. is good, but limited in choice. Very nice ambience. Breakfast was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: genolee
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience with this hotel. Flew in late to MIA and had about a 30 minute wait for the shuttle but driver was nice and got us to hotel quickly. Area may not be the nicest, but hotel itself is really nice. Pretty decor and high end linens and bath fixtures. Staff at front desk was very helpful and friendly. Our price included the breakfast and we really enjoyed it and staff there were very friendly and efficient as well. Paid the $10 each for shuttle to cruise ship in AM and they delivered us right to the ship safe and sound. Very happy with our experience!

Reviews.Title: “nice room decor,,,but that is it”
Reviews.Author: ken1013
Reviews.Content: when booking the room for post cruise stay,,breakfast was to be inculded,,it was'nt,,$10.00. no shuttle to pick you up from cruise dock,,,called the front desk to arrange for shuttle at port of miami,,gave me the man number to call he hung up on me each time (3) i asked how much it will be to get us from the port to the hotel when finally got to hotel in a cab told front desk about the situation her response was he must could nt hear you,,,he heard everything elese i was saying but not that ,,,okay:/...one of the reason for booking the room was because they had a pre-post cruise deal,,and also airport and breakfast,,,which they stated but came out not to be true,,i stayed at a south beach upscale hotel that really did have the pre cruise and post cruise stay and i wish i had went back to them for my post cruise stay,,and for the price i could have stayed at place with a better location not in a good area at all. they do have a airport shuttle,,,but other then that rude staff,,misleading at booking and i just wasnt happy with the whole stay,,,

Reviews.Title: “But the housekeeper raided the frig!!?!?”
Reviews.Author: pflau
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights during my visit to Miami, picked a room with microwave and frig so I could keep some cold drinks around. The first night was great. I had no complaint. When I returned the following night I loaded the frig with some drinks and desert for next night's Heat-Knicks game on TV. The next morning I heard a knock on the door, and there was the maid. I told her I didn't have change, but I did leave a dollar because that's all I had. I'm a great tipper and have pictures from previous trips to prove it - when you leave a good tip sometimes the housekeeper makes interesting decoration out of the hand towels and beddings. I was prepared to make up for all these by leaving a big tip the next morning. When I came back that night just in time for the Heat-Knicks game, the frig was empty. I was upset to say the least. Was it because I only left a dollar tip? I had my luggage in the room and my clothes hanging in the closet so it's not like somebody could've thought I had checked out and forgot the items in the frig. Well I did not have time to go out and get drinks, so I was stuck watching the game with no desert and no drink. I packed and checked out the following morning without leaving a tip. So my suggestion if you plan to stay at this place - leave a note on the frig that say do not remove any food.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, but no wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: kamy52364
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel overnight before catching a flight back home. The front desk was very helpful and polite. The internet access at the business center was down the entire evening, but the front desk was nice enough to print off our boarding passes for us. The breakfast buffet is very good, although pricey at $12.00 per person. We were unable to get wi-fi in our rooms although it is supposedly available. The pool area is small and is right off of the main road with only a fence to separate it from busy traffic. The workout facility has new equipment and was not busy. The rooms were spacious and clean, with comfortable beds, a mini fridge, microwave and safe. The AC worked fine, but the drapes hung down over the unit, causing them to blow everywhere when the unit ran. All in all, a decent hotel and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: PAL71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Feb 10 before departure from the Port of Miami. This is a nice, clean hotel, close to the airport and has reasonable rates. Also enjoyed the breakfast at IHOP just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “New clean hotel for precruise passengers”
Reviews.Author: ChiromomRaleighNc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this best western hotel for the last two cruises we took in 2011. Once in January and again in December. The hotel has a free shuttle from Miami airport to take you to the hotel even late at night which got there fast and was convenient. When we went in January 2011 we received a free continental breakfast and free shuttle to the port the morning of our cruise. The hotel had just opened and was only couple months old but when we went back in December in 2011 the breakfast is no longer free and the shuttle to the port isn't free either. They still have a continental breakfast but it isn't cheap. They will still pick up from the airport to bring you back to the hotel. We wish they would bring back the same amenities they had offered initially. It is a very clean hotel. The beds are very comfortable and it is quiet in your rooms so you don't hear others. We will stay here again on our next cruise too. It was only a $30 dollar fee for all of us to the port next am. I would recommend this hotel for any families traveling or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place and a Good Choice for Cruisers!”
Reviews.Author: timman19
Reviews.Content: This is a rather nice hotel that appears brand new. We stayed here for two nights prior to taking a cruise from Port of Miami and for one night after our cruise ended. Upon arriving in Miami, we took their shuttle from the terminal to the hotel. The shuttles runs every half an hour on the hour. When you get outside, itâ€™s best to call the hotel to figure out when the next one will come along. There are tons of airport hotels in Miami, and more than one Best Western, so keep a sharp eye out for the van. When we arrived at the hotel, we were checked in very quickly. The lobby area is a bit small and it doesnâ€™t take much for it to get full. The check-in staff was very polite and professional as were all of the staff members that we encountered. Our room was outstanding. It was brand new! The room was spotless and the beds very comfortable. The flat screen television was a nice touch. The room was a nice size and the bathroom large and very clean. The rooms have climate control and it cooled down or warmed up pretty quickly. The hotel has done away with its complimentary breakfast. However, if you had booked your room when it was still offered, as we did, you still got it. If not, youâ€™ll have to pay for it. The breakfast was buffet style and served in the lobby restaurant with excellent omelets made to order. There was also bacon and sausage as well as danish, breads and cereals. Service was decent but sometimes it took servers a little while to refill coffee cups or to return with requested items. They seemed to be a bit understaffed but they did their best. The restaurant also had a bar and was open for lunch and dinner. It seemed to be doing a rather good business. The hotel is in a very Latino part of the city and is perfectly safe. There are not a whole lot of restaurants but there was a 24 hour IHOP a few blocks away. A quick taxi ride can take you to many good places to eat. The front desk had many good recommendations. We used the workout room but the weather was a bit cold for us to use the pool. The pool is of decent size and is almost out on the street! However, it is surrounded by shrubs and bushes that conceal it from view. It was clean and itâ€™s too bad that the water was too cold for swimming. One of the two elevators here broke down on the second night. This caused issues as it took a lot longer for guests to get up and down. The situation was even more complicated in the morning as it was still broken. It was a cruise ship sailing day and guests were having a hard time getting an elevator with all of their luggage to the lobby. We noticed this and got there early. If you are going on a cruise, the hotel can arrange transportation to the port for $10 a person. That was a good deal. You can also make arrangements to be taken back to the hotel if you are staying there after your cruise as we did. It was quite busy on sailing day but the people in charge of the vans and buses knew what they were doing and it everything well organized. If you are taking their shuttle to the airport after checking out, give yourself extra time to get to the airport. We arrived for the 5:00 a.m. shuttle with 15 minutes to spare to find it already full. There were other people in the same predicament who also had early flights. The staff on duty called taxis but given the time of the day, it was not easy to get many. Luckily, the shuttle van returned quickly and we were able to get to the airport in time. We saw a bus that the hotel owns in the parking lot but for some reason it wasnâ€™t being used for the airport trips and seemed to be reserved for the port shuttles. The driver was a bit miffed about that himself. Overall, a nice stay prior and after our cruise. Recommended. My compliments to the hotel on honoring the free breakfast offer that existed when we made our reservations.

Reviews.Title: “A huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: FinnishMexican
Reviews.Content: I wanted to book a nice hotel for the last night of a 2 week holiday in Florida before flying back to Europe. I chose the PW Premier, and regretted it greatly! The hotel is new, but unpersonal and bland. The front office staff has a bad attitude, the type that asks you for your confirmation number when arriving... at every other hotel during our trip they could find us by our last name (btw the only family with our last name, so no confusions possible). We had booked a suite, which turned out to be a large room with a sofa bed. In all other hotels this meant two connecting rooms. The room was also the closest one to the busy avenue and therefore was very noisy. The heating was blowing full blast when we entered through a mini-split system (no central aircon). We left for dinner as we had just driven accross the country, and then I left to return our rental car. I had planned to take the airport shuttle back, but it never arrived. I waited over an hour, and saw all the other shuttles pass by twice or three times. I eventually took a taxi, but had lost an hour. I arrived back at the room at 10.30, to find that the sofa bed had sheets! I called front desk who told me that house keeping was not there and he was alone (!), and if I could wait an hour. NO! We had an early transatlantic flight and I was in the same room as my parents who are in their mid seventies... After an argument the front desk person left to search for what he could find; two sheets and a pillow case. No pillow, no comforter. I suggested to simply put me in another room in order to solution an issue, but apparently he couldn't. After a bad nights sleep I asked to speak to the hotel manager. I was helped by the front office manager who apologized and offered to provide me with a free night whenever I wanted to give them a second chance. Upto today I have not received his email, over a month later!! There is a big selection of hotels close to the aiport, choose another one. I heard the Hilton is very nice and the price similar, even lower.

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the convention”
Reviews.Author: Judy O
Reviews.Content: We attended the Market America World Convention at the American Airlines Arena. I was a nice experience to be able to come back to a warm, clean, comfortable and extremely attentive personnel. The staff even secured a second room for us with double beds the following day of the convention. We added two more people. We will again use the Best Western and recommend this hotel to friends and family when they visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great for overnight stays”
Reviews.Author: dudesd
Reviews.Content: Just stayed two different nights on a trip through miami. Overall very pleased. Rooms were exceptionally clean and well outfitted. Very comfortable. This hotel is very close to the airport and they have free shuttles to and from the airport which we used both and were very efficient. They also offer a 10.00 shuttle to and from the port which was very helpful and much cheaper than a taxi. The staff at the front desk were very kind and helpful. One thing though is that this hotel is not near much else so there are not many restaurants or shopping. so you would need a car if staying here for vacation. But for just overnights it would be fantastic. My only concern was with the restaurant. They charge a steep 12.00 for the breakfast buffet which isnt much and the staff does not speak english so was confusing and frustrating eating breakfast and trying to even pay them. we were not served and had to find someone in order to even pay. but otherwise was content with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was pretty decent. Pool was freezing.”
Reviews.Author: breeleeslady11
Reviews.Content: Pool in a horrible spot right on the street and the building blocks out the sun's rays almost alll day. However, hotel is clean, rooms are very nice and staff was friendly. I would return again just not to swim!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel close to MIA âœˆ”
Reviews.Author: singec
Reviews.Content: A free hotel shuttle bus leaves from MIA airport on the departures level (2) and it is a quick ride to the hotel. The first morning return shuttle leaves the hotel at 5am and then usually every 30 minutes. Reasonable clean modern hotel with helpful adequate staff, FREE in room wifi and wired connection is a obvious welcome bonus for checking in online etc. Furnishing is neutral and basic but more importantly the bed is comfortable and the rooms fairly sound proofed. My room was not facing the main road but the rear of the hotel, not much of a vista but very peaceful. The bathroom was ok but dont expect a toothbrush kit. Staff were polite and helpful with my simple requests.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Bernard P
Reviews.Content: Nice looking hotel but don't let that fool you. The bad started right from the beginning. Even after calling the shuttle from the airport it never came. When we called the third time they told us to just take a taxi. Checking in was ok. We were told about there special breakfast and shuttle to the port of Miami offer (20.00 per room). Thinking this was a good deal we accepted. The next morning at 7am we called down for the shuttle and were told no problem and were given a time of 11am for the shuttle. When we came down at 10:45 to catch the shuttle they had forgot to put our group on the list. We went on our cruise, which was wonderful. When we returned home we noticed an extra charge for 170.00 on our card. Upon calling they explained that the "great deal" was changed to per person and that they also charged 2 other rooms charges to us. After several back and fourth conversations with a front desk employee and myself we are now hoping to have the charges reversed(haven't as of yet). The manager would not speak to me directly either. Very poor run establishment overall!

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking hotel but poor service”
Reviews.Author: shirley223
Reviews.Content: While the decor is very nice this hotel needs to train their staff to be much more helpful. We were actually treated quite rudely at the desk. Since we had never been to Miami before we tried to ask questions at the front desk. The staff were not at all helpful. Upon check-in we found out that there had been a shuttle from the airport which we had not been told about even though I had called the hotel in person. Even though they claim to be an airport hotel the cab ride still cost us $30. The hotel is also not near to anything accept the airport. We were going on a cruise the next day, but if you are planning on staying more than one night rent a car. I was also very disappointed in the breakfast. They charge $9 for basically the same breakfast that is complementary at other Best Westerns. We have stayed at Best Westerns in many places and this one was at best mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nosassenach
Reviews.Content: A very smart new hotel,clean and comfortable exeptionaly quiet for an airport hotel. Checkin and out quick and efficient. A fantastic breakfast that we had to pay for $12 each this is the first time we have ever had to pay for a breakfast in a BW, (but well worth the money) The bar and Restaurant closed at 2200hrs with no facility for room service. we arrived just after ten due to a delayed longhaul flight,the lack of room service in a hotel with bar and restaurant was very dissapointing. Airport shuttle every 30 minutes, you have to stand at the side of the road and watch for the shuttle passing and flag it down (But this is Miami Airport which we will never use again)

Reviews.Title: “Location, facility - terrific; service - not so much...”
Reviews.Author: SCBoston01
Reviews.Content: My impression of the hotel is similar to lorfw87. The hotel is spanking new but the front desk and restaurant service is severely lacking. The room is very nicely decorated and very clean. The housekeeping staff are very professional and did a great job at keeping our room spotless during our stay. But after a great night's sleep (yes, the bed and pillows are terrific), we went downstairs for the buffet. We had to wait a bit to be seated, not because the place was busy. There was no signage about waiting to be seated or seating yourself. When someone finally appeared, he was flustered. When we sat down, the waiter did not ask if we wanted to see a menu or anything about the buffet. He also failed to ask if we wanted coffee or juice. The waitress who was supposed to working the room, wasn't. The table next to us was dirty, I had to bring it her attention. While waiting for coffee and juice, which was brought to me and not my husband, even though we asked it for each of us, the loud, booming voice of the person working the omelet station filled the room. He was talking non-stop to a fellow, even while making an omelet for a guest. The other fellow left after ten minutes. Although the man was a talker, he does make a mean omelet. The rest of the stay was fine except at checkout time. This is when the unprofessionalism of the staff really showed. At checkout, my husband read over the bill. We were charged for two meals and drinks at the bar. The bar staff couldn't be bothered to check if the signature matched the room number, it didn't. When we brought it to the attention of the counterperson, she asked to see our invoice, which we didn't have because we didn't eat at the bar at any time. It was then that another guest appeared and the phone rang at the same time. The counterperson reached for the phone. My husband and myself are customer service people and realize that the customer in front of you is what you should be focusing on. The counterperson didn't get the memo. My husband had to ask her to not answer the phone or the other guest and take of our situation first. She was very, very flustered. It was then that a manager appeared from the back and removed the charges from our bill. During all the action, I saw the waiter walking around the lobby looking for a guest who didn't sign his bill. With so many people with hotel experience out of work, you'd would think that this Best Western Premier could fill their staff with a top notch team both behind the desk and at the restaurant/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms; not so great service”
Reviews.Author: lorfw87
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely beautiful inside and out. We walked into the room and loved the color scheme and decor. Nice size. Had everything we needed and more! Other than a couple small stains, it seemed extremely clean. Their pillows and pillow-top mattress were to die for! For the most part, the room was quiet. Never once did I hear anything coming from the rooms next to or above me, and I heard little street noise (though we did get there late) but I was awoken at 1:30 in the morning by a motorcycle idling in the parking lot for several minutes. Certainly not the fault of the hotel, because I know motorcycles can be loud. I wasn't coherent enough to fully figure out just how loud it truly was, but I don't feel that, being on the 5th floor with the window closed, it shouldn't be loud enough in the room to be awoken by. Also, all they have covering the windows is a sheer white curtain - no black out curtains, so depending on which side of the hotel your room is on (one side seemed to be facing a more residential/less busy/less lighted area), it likely will not get very dark. I can live with a motorcycle waking me up, because I know that's a one-time thing that can happen at any hotel, and I can also live with not having black out curtains, so my only real complaint was the service, which to me is the most important part of any experience. Check-in and check-out were slow, and while not necessarily unfriendly, definitely was not at all warm or friendly in person, or when I spoke with them on the phone. I was fully prepared to give a 4 star rating (3 for the service and 4 for everything else) before I filled out my online survey for the property, which was largely positive. I mentioned in that survey the same thing I mentioned here - that I was not impressed with the service, and the response I received back was a template email that apologized for not exceeding my expectations. I don't expect much, but I would expect that when I mention that I was not impressed with the service, I would get some sort of personalized response back. All it did was perpetuate my opinion that the service isn't that great.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay still the best choice near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Helicopterbob
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the cleanliness of the hotel and the attentiveness of the staff. Disappointed with the lack of breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “"A" for Effort, "C" for Execution”
Reviews.Author: shoeluv
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nicely appointed and spacious accommodations. Close to Miami International Airport with free shuttle service provided. Restaurant on property. Friendly staff. Cons: Other than the airport, the hotel is not close to good shopping or dining. Service, while friendly, is inconsistent and lengthy at best. Airport shuttle, though free, may be non-existent unless you are prepared to wait 1+ hours. When the Best Western (BW) Hotels started to segregate their properties by class, I wondered how this would translate in the real world. Essentially, a BW Premier property is equivalent to the newly refurbished Holiday Inn properties or Hilton Garden Inns. If you go with this comparison in mind, it will help set your expectation level. The BW Miami Int'l Airport Hotel is a fairly new property that is still, painfully, working out all the kinks. On the positive side, it is lovely and spacious. In other words, it still has the "new car smell," if you know what I mean. Every room has a large LCD flatscreen T.V., refrigerator, microwave, room safe, etc. Now, you may be thinking that every BW has this stuff, so what? You're right in one sense. Essentially all the BW hotels do have these things, but the difference is in the quality of these amenities. Towels and sheets are more premium, as well as the appliances. Also, more thought has been put into the interior design of the place, so it feels modern and more upscale. This property has a full service restaurant that you wouldn't find at Plus or regular BW properties. Having said all that, there are issues. First, the shuttle service is inconsistent. The first time I stayed at this property, the shuttle picked me up within 20 minutes, and there was friendly service from beginning to end. The second time, the shuttle never came. I called 3 different times to advise the staff where I was at MIA airport to no avail. I wound up taking a cab. Later that night, I ran into another patron who admitted he waited for an hour before throwing in the towel and hiring a cab. Second, the location of the hotel means that food options will be very limited. As another reviewer noted, there aren't a lot of restaurants nearby other than fast food options. This means you may be tempted to try the in house restaurant. Save yourself the headache and don't do it. They are still working on major issues. My first experience was to order room service from the restaurant, and it arrived mostly in to-go containers, and lukewarm with some parts of the meal still being cold as if it had been previously frozen. The second time I decided to eat at the restaurant hoping to improve my chances of a decent meal. No such luck. The restaurant was so swamped with guests and lacking waitstaff that I felt as though I were in a losing game of "Diner Dash." While I truly wish I could give this property more stars, the truth is that the price point is competing with Holiday Inns and BW isn't on the winning side. For the same price, you get consistency and quality of service. Maybe in 12 months time, the BW Premier will finally be worthy of its name. Until then, for the price, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent BW hotel. Would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January 2011 for one night before embarking on a cruise. The hotel was open for less than a month and was still in mint condition. The free airport shuttle arrived rather quickly (mid afternoon on Saturday) and drove us to the hotel, which was about a 5 minute drive away. The shuttle bus was also new, and still had that new car smell! The decor throughout the hotel was quite nice and everything was very clean, which was apparent as soon as we arrived on the property. The room was also very nice, clean and well lit with comfortable beds, a flat panel TV, work desk ,mini fridge and microwave. The hotel is located on a busy street corner, but the rooms were fairly well insulated from the noise of the street traffic. There's a pool area, fitness room, and there was also a locked luggage storage room in the lobby if you didn't want all your bags in your room. At the time we stayed at the hotel, there was a free continental breakfast, but the onsite restaurant was not full service. I understand now that the restaurant has breakfast/lunch/dinner with room service available. There are some chain restaurants to the North within a short walking distance (Pizza Hut, IHOP, etc.), and can be seen how close when riding the shuttle to the hotel. It really depends how far you want to walk. There is also a strip mall about a 10 minute walk to the East on W. Flagler (less than 1/2 mile) that has a Publix supermarket and CVS drugstore. I found this hotel to be an excellent choice for a property close to the airport, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bazz11
Reviews.Content: Nice, good sized rooms and very clean. Friendly and helpful front desk. We arrived at 10pm after 3 hrs trying to get out of Miami airport (the worst airport in the world). We had to get a taxi for $35 as the shuttle bus did not show for 30 minutes. We were quite hungry and the restaurant and bar were closed at the hotel. The only place nearby was a Burger King. We were not THAT hungry. The girl at the front desk suggested that the bus driver (who had appeared by then) could drop us at a nearby restaurant. We took this option and went to the Latin Cafe. The food was great and Luis, the bus driver, came to take us back when we called. This made up a little for the airport fiasco

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: tipijo
Reviews.Content: Newly built Best Western about 2 miles from the airport. Wow, this hotel is really nice. The place was spotless. The rooms were beautiful and the bed was so comfy...wish I had it at home. The towels in the bathroom were so plush. Flat screen TV was huge. There is no free breakfast but the restaurant serves breakfast, lunch and dinner for nominal charge. Lots of breakfast items on the buffet plus a waiter making omelets. For dinner I had the Filet Mignon...it was delicious, just the way I like it. My husband had minestrone soup....liked it a lot, and a club sandwich, it was good and it was huge. The people there were wonderful and very friendly. Shuttle runs every half hour to the airport. I would recommend this hotel. This is one of the nicest Best Westerns we have ever stayed at except for the one in Vancouver, BC.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: worslip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night between flights. Room was modern and large as was the bathroom I like the hotel design where the elevator and ice / soda machine is recessed away from the rooms corridor thereby reducing the ambient noise. Only one minor gripe : we had the BUFFET breakfast. (emphasis added). When we got the bill, we noted 18% added as a service charge! I'm still trying to reconcile a service charge on a meal where clearly I was serving myself!

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, well furnished, great nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: JanSWales_UK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new, very nicely furnished. Rooms are lovely and the bed was one of the best I have ever slept in. Extremely comfortable. Good clean nicely appointed rooms with fridge, microwave, coffee etc. Large flat screen tvs. The area is not one for walking around and the only place to eat, that we could see, was Burger King. Never the less there is a bar and restaurant in the hotel. we weren't very hungry after our long flight, so shared a club sandwich and had a drink. The food was ok (it wasn't fresh chicken breast in the sandwich just sliced deli chicken). Other diners seemed to be enjoying their food. Breakfast was nice with fresh cooked eggs and a good choice. It could have been a little hotter, but it was all fresh and nicely displayed. Except for the pastries which were chewy rather than fresh and crumbly. But good coffee and nice fruit. The shuttle was useful although we were just about to get a taxi at the airport as we had waited 40 minutes. But it turned up and we used it the next day to return to the airport to transfer to the car hire centre to pick up our rental car. The staff throughout, from reception to the bar staff were friendly and courteous. If you want somewhere to sleep,near the airport, I recommend this,because the room was first class.

Reviews.Title: “nice beds”
Reviews.Author: Jos v
Reviews.Content: Location was ok, but nothing special. The shuttle service was fine and the beds were great

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RenatoBedin
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel in Miami Airport area. Comfortable bed, big room and big bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: MexicoMadness
Reviews.Content: Most of the previous reviews were pretty fair...nice accommodations, well located , friendly staff...I got a better rate through hotels.com than the BW web page or thru the hotel itself. Would surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for airport exchange”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: The room was huge, beautiful, and clean. Staff very friendly. The area is without charm but as a place to stay while passing through it was great. Free bus to airport an essential plus.

Reviews.Title: “old on the outside, new on the inside”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyghart
Reviews.Content: The hotel gives me a new impression of best western hotels. This hotel looks old on the outside but the inside looks recently remodeled and very new. Bed was very comfortable, big room, big bathroom. Overall... very good and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: RBabe
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel thanks to other reviews on Trip Advisor. We stayed for an extended vacation over Christmas weekend. The hotel was newer and the decor contemporary - everything was clean and bright. We were traveling with our kids and would have like a slightly larger room, but it was also clean, bright and adequate - worth the money. The breakfast buffet was not included with the price of the hotel - it is $12 per adult. If you have a car, I would recommend checking out some of the restaurants close by. We found a Panera Bread within a few miles in Coral Gables, and had a decent (and more affordable) breakfast at a Cuban restaurant â€“ Versailles Restaurant (also a few miles away). There is also a Publix Supermarket down a few blocks on Flager that you can get snacks and drinks. The good thing about this hotel is the location â€“ it seemed close to all the highways and within 20 minutes from some of the tourist spots in Miami. Also, parking was free with this hotel compared to some of the other hotels near the Airport. The hotel seemed pretty quiet and there was not a lot of noise from the street. Unlike, many hotels, we were able to open the windows and get a nice breeze into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ashleylpage
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel! The front desk staff were plesant. They have a little store full of snacks and other things, which was very convenient. The restaurant and gym looked nice, although our stay was short, so we never went there. There was was a decent pool, which served its purpose. I was surprised at how nice the room was, being that it's a Best Western. The hotel chain definetly stepped it up with their PREMIER hotels. It was modern, had a flat screen tv, and the beds were comfy & plush. I know this sounds weird, but I loved the towels in the room. They dried my body in seconds, literally. The location was not as close to the airport as one would like, but this is an excellent hotel if you have a car or rent a car. It's only about a 15 minute drive to Miami Beach, and even closer to Biscayne Bay. The only downside to the hotel is really it's location. It's located in the heart of Miami aka the hood. There's a CVS, fast food restaurants, and a casino close by, which is convenient. But the area is overally run down. The price was excellent though. We figured we would save money staying here and just driving to Miami Beach. If you're looking for a more Miami Beach oriented stay, I would say find a hotel actually by South Beach though. That's the only thing I felt lacking from the hotel. Other than that, perfect hotel! I would definetly stay again if I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Best Wetern”
Reviews.Author: CYAMA
Reviews.Content: This is the Best hotel from The Best Westerns that I ever stayed. Friendly Staff Small, but modern decorated lobby. Everything here is new and nicely design. The location is great . Everything is new, has two large elevator. The suite is big as the bathroom ( and very clean too). Has a freee parkink and internet ( the breakfast was not include and was not cheap so I didn't taste) I and my wife stayed two nights in November and we do recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great”
Reviews.Author: Janetbme
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight layover in Miami on my way to Port-au-Prince, and this hotel was perfect. The shuttle arrived just when they said it would, and the driver was as friendly and helpful as he could be. Check-in went smoothly, and the room was awesome! Big screen TV, super comfy bed, nice bath . . . I had a great dinner in the restaurant and a wonderful night's sleep. The breakfast was good (try the omelet station if it's available), and I enjoyed a relaxing morning writing my Christmas cards before the shuttle took me back to the airport. All in all, it was just exactly what I needed, and I look forward to staying there again the next time I'm in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “odor ruined it”
Reviews.Author: bridgette_ca
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the superbly decorated lobby, I was cordially greeted by Natalia. She immediately assigned me to a room on the seventh floor and gave me my room key. The customer service coupled with the modern dÃ©cor was what I expected when I initially made my reservations with Best Western Premier Miami International Airport Hotel & Suites. After a long flight from Los Angeles, I was ready to settle in. Upon entering my room, I immediately noticed an odor of mildew. Upon further inspection I realized the smell was coming from the air conditioning unit. Relaxing in my room was going to take longer than I anticipated. I gathered my belongings and went back down to the front desk. Leo assisted me this time. He was very professional and apologized for my inconvenience. He promptly assigned me to another room. I took my luggage to a new room and there was no mildew smell coming from the air conditioning unit. Unfortunately the carpet smelled musty. This is where my disappointment begins. After shuttling my luggage to two rooms at Best Western Premier Miami International Airport Hotel & Suites, I still had not found a room where I could rest comfortably. Once again Leo courteously assigned me to another room, 524. Although, the design of this room and the two others I was in earlier, were upscale, the stale motel smell soured me on this hotel. This was my third room and frankly, I was tired, so I didnâ€™t ask for another room. The room was extremely comfortable, however. I especially enjoyed the bed. It was plush and difficult to leave in the morning. The next morning I showered, only to find that the tub drained rather slowly. It took the water so long to drain that I had to turn the water off and on throughout my shower. I alerted the front desk and they immediately notified maintenance. The problem was corrected by the end of the day. The complimentary breakfast is better at the $70 a night Best Westerns. The orange juice tasted as flavorful as orange colored water. The fruit wasn't sweet, but I guess you can't blame them for that. The staff was very cordial and even made a waffle for me. I expected a waffle like I've had many times before, instead I get this undercooked, and super sweet waffle. I was so disgusted I left the restaurant. I paid $118.64 a night and don't think I should've paid more than $70.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bedouin2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here in November before driving to the Gulf Coast.We had prebooked and prepaid for the hotel before they stopped the free breakfast and they gave us vouchers for the 2 days.Rooms were good.Clean,spacious and nicely designed/decorated.Breakfast was pretty good,not the best I've had but fine.Would not be so happy if I had to pay their current price.Service on the whole was efficient and cheerful. The shuttle to the airport was a good bonus,as we had to use it several times.Only one thing let them down.For the whole time we were there,only one lift worked and the wait when you needed a lift was tiresome.Should have got it repaired quicker. On the whole a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the discounted price I got”
Reviews.Author: CarolMaeRay
Reviews.Content: If you need a hotel near the Miami airport this is a very safe bet. The decor is minimal but striking. Bedding and room was near elegant, on par with a Marriott. Front desk is fairly efficient. Free shuttle to and from the airport, handy to meet the cruise shuttle. The only downside was the service in the restaurant for dinner. Food was good, but the the servers need a few lessons on how to wait on tables. For example, when serving dinner make certain the customer has tableware with which to eat the dinner. I had to get up and borrow from an empty table. The buffet breakfast was a little pricey but well done. There are two prices for the breakfast buffet--one for everything but a freshly made omelet and one with the omelet. On caution however--if you do not wish to eat at the hotel and do not have a car you may get stuck at teh Burger King across the street. To end on an up note: their free internet wireless was very good for speed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lateasusual2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional for the price. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff was helpfull and friendly. We stayed 12/3/11 and left our car for 7 days during our cruise without a problem. They do have by far, the nicest breakfast buffet for hotels in this price range. Freshly cooked omlets to order if you prefer, were delicious along with the wide variety of other breakfast choices. Just far enough away from the airport to be nice and quiet. Very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ByFarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Miami Airport for one night in Oct 11. The hotel was of a very high standard we were very impress with a great room & the high quality breakfast. It took us two hrs to get our hire car so I wasnâ€™t in the best mood when we got in, it was very late & the service when we check in finally put me in a better moon. Great first impression last, I would stay at this hotel again when Iâ€™m in Miami for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “MRB Review”
Reviews.Author: JackGil142
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before cruise and 1 night after. Lovely property, well maintained. Helpful, pleasant staff. Very good value; excellent breakfast; free internet access. Because it is a relatively small property, single van makes rounds at airport every half hour, but transportation service was very giid and it included taking us to a neighborhood restaurant and picking us up. We would definitely stay there again and based on our experience at this property, would consider other Best Westerns if location suited our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WD80
Reviews.Content: I come to Miami on a monthly basis and tend to stay in different hotels depending on what's happening in the city. I was in Miami for a Christmas party and decided to stay at this Best Western because of its close proximity to the party and reasonable room rate. The hotel neighborhood was primarily retail strip malls and apartments, so there was alot of hustle and bustle with cars and people. Because the hotel is relatively new, it stands out. Check-in was smooth and easy. There was free parking with a guard monitoring the area. The king size bedroom was clean and comfortable. There was a mini fridge, nice size TV, desk table/chair, most of what you would expect for a 3 star hotel. The one thing that surprised me was that the hot buffet breakfast cost $12 dollars and continental buffet was $10 dollars. This is the first Best Western that I have stayed at where the buffet breakfast was not free. All in all, I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “For us, a 5”
Reviews.Author: muskrat2
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked very well for us. We had to wait awhile for the airport shuttle, but not unreasonably long. The rooms are fresh and new. The beds were comfortable and passed the bedbug inspection. We had booked about six months prior to the stay using BW Rewards points. Check in was friendly and efficient. We were pleased to learn that, because we had booked prior to the change in policy, our breakfast was included with the room. The breakfast room also doubles as the restaurant/bar. The breakfast had a nice selection of hot and cold items and an omlet station. Now, however, breakfast is not included with the room and costs $12.00. That might be a little pricey. We also had a burger and fries in the resturant/bar the evening of our arrival. It was OK, but nothing great. We paid for it by credit card and that was the only charge that was on our bill--no problems. An easy shuttle ride back to the airport the next morning to pick up our rental car.

Reviews.Title: “UNAUTHERIZED CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: camtraveller_11
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, but unfortunately I also had fraud charges on my credit card after my stay on Nov 27, 2011, also after I had settled my bill on departure date. I phoned and asked to speak to manager and was unable to get a name or contact # . when I spoke to the clerk she told me the 50.30 that I had posted on my credit card on dec 1 (3 days after I settled my bill) did not show anywhere on their files. These hotels are independently owned and operated, but Best Western is a large chain and its unfortunate when incidents like this occur DO NOT STAY AT THIS BEST WESTERN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Things stolen from the room”
Reviews.Author: Kaisa N
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, from 28th till 30th of November. The hotel was good and clean. However a bag full of my purchases stolen from the room. I reported the issue and asked to see the security camera recordings, was not allowed to see them. I was told that the recordings do not work on lobby on the time of our arrival or from the hallway when the housekeeper cleaned our room. It seemed that there was nobody willing to co-operate with me concerning this matter. I have sent emails to the hotel, no reply.

Reviews.Title: “very nice rooms, patchy food, poor airport shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: TriciaMc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 separate nights while passing through Miami airport. The rooms were large, comfortable and well-equipped - except that non-dairy creamer powder was supplied with the coffee (yuk). On both occasions we had major problems getting the airport shuttle to the hotel. The shuttle runs every 30 mins, you don't have to phone for it, you just stand on the kerb and peer at all the minibuses going past (great fun at night when all you can see is the headlights coming towards you). The last shuttle is 11:30 pm (currently). Of course, if you go into the airport to look for information or a phone, you risk missing your shuttle and waiting another 30 mins. My advice would be, stay at a hotel a bit further away where you phone for the shuttle from the free phone inside the airport. Or, go to the kerb and phone the airport from your mobile to check if the shuttle is running. Also, make sure you have the correct airport Best Western - check the address! Shuttle service from the hotel to the airport was excellent. Breakfast was patchy - early Saturday morning, food was poor, coffee stewed and foul, and there was a fly on the fresh fruit. Late Monday morning, food was quite good, fresh omelettes cooked to order, coffee tasted like the cheapest powdered instant, no English breakfast tea. The information on hotel services in the folder in the room is not accurate. They do not serve lunch, only breakfast and dinner. The desk advised us we couldn't get food delivered after midnight, even though the leaflets in the room said 24 hour delivery. There are vending machines in the lobby but they only take dollar bills. The ATM is very slow, and timed out when trying to contact my UK bank. The gym was small but looked like it had decent equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud charges”
Reviews.Author: C_ATravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here along with a few other parties and we have all had fraudulent credit card charges put on our credit cards after we paid our bills. Very disappointing. The hotel is new so it is good but not when you have to deal with fraudulent credit card charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: zparyani
Reviews.Content: I couldn't afford the crazy prices at the hotels in Miami Beach and stayed at this hotel and commuted to the beach. The drive is not bad at all...about 15 mins with traffic. This is a newer hotel and the furnishings are modernish. All the pictures you see on the Best Western web site are true to life. There is a regularly running shuttle to the airport...every 30 minutes and it's free. The drivers are pleasant and helpful. The trip to the airport is 10-12 minutes. Having said that there were a couple of points that stood out: The service at this hotel was really not that great...just passable. Most staff did not make eye contact or smile when they passed you in the lobby or hallways. English seemed to be the second language for many staff and left me unsure as to how much of my requests were understood. The breakfast is an exorbitant $12.99 for a small buffet...I went to the iHop which is a short walk away and where the service is really great. The dining area is only open for 3 hours in the a.m. and another 3 in the evening. I did not find the area scary. It is a predominantly Hispanic neighbourhood, residential and if you use the public transit, you will find that most of the people on the bus are working class Spanish-speakers. A short drive from the hotel is an area called the Miracle Mile (closest Starbucks and a lot of chi chi stores). Coral Gables is another area worth visiting, especially at night....20 minutes drive from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good rooms and decent food”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTraills
Reviews.Content: The wife and I were looking for a location between the airport and the port on a night over before a cruise. The location was great, only about ten minutes from the airport. There was an issue with the shuttle, but I willing to concede that had mostly to do with the chaos which is the pick up/dropoff area at MIA. The room was spacious and neat, complete with an iPod dock /alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bschott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were disappointed by this motel. She did not feel safe at all in the area and there were not many eating choices nearby, just a Burger King across the street and an IHOP 2 blocks away. First floor rest rooms were locked and Business Center workstations were password protected. You can print boarding passes from there, but have to pick them up at the front desk. All signs that this is not in "the best of neighborhoods". My wife wanted some "sun time" so she went to the outdoor pool, but it was quite noisy, on the ground floor and just a sidewalk and cement block wall from a busy road. I came down looking for a sauna/jacuzzi, but they had none! Not sure how this property get a top "Premier" rating from BW. I must admit the breakfast was super! Great food and a nice selection of hot food. Check in was quite slow. We arrived at 1:30 and were asked to come back "in half an hour". Came back then and still no rooms, but then a 1 bed room opened up and they put us there. It was convenient to the airport, but located in a busy city area. If we fly out of Miami again, I'll probably look for a different place.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel excellent design the room is beautiful, clean”
Reviews.Author: Insigni
Reviews.Content: The hotel excellent design the room is beautiful, is clean, the personal front desk is nice location is perfect This is de best hotel close the airport.....

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, poor catering.”
Reviews.Author: Pinsinamap
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for one night as part of a flight layover. The shuttle picked us up as advertised and we only had to wait for 15 minutes outside of the terminal. The check-in was fast and friendly. The room we had was spacious and clean and the a/c worked well. The restaurant/bar, however, left a quite a bit to be desired. The staff seemed to be poorly trained in even the most basic of catering and waiting skills. On top of that the food took a long time to arrive and when it did it was cold and some of the dishes where incorrect. I good place to stay, just donâ€™t expect much from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect solution near MIAMI Airport!”
Reviews.Author: YleniaY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! The location is perfect! Near MIAMI Airport with free shuttle service. The rooms are well furnished, really comfortable and offer a relaxing atmosphere. The breakfast is ok. The swimming pool is not so big and it is near the street therefore it is not really quite. Anyway it is clean and good enough to relax. The fitness studio is well equipped. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but.....”
Reviews.Author: pballard
Reviews.Content: I came off an international flight, and It started when I checked out their shuttle service at the airport, and was told they looped every half hour. In reality, I stood & waited 50 minutes (would have taken a cab, but kept thinking they'd be there). The room was spacious and clean, but it was freezing. I tried to turn down the AC, and a hotel employee couldn't figure it out either....just pulled the plug out of the wall, so I awakened in the middle of the night hot & sticky and had to get up and plug it in again. Nice big flat screen TV, but wish they had a card listing stations & channels. There's a small restaurant with bar on the main floor, and I looked in the room for a menu. No luck, so I went down, ordered a drink & dinner and asked if they could deliver it to my room. Answer was no due to shortage of help, so would I please wait at the bar and carry it up myself. On a positive note, the food was good, the staff was pleasant, the price was good, and I was only there overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: MAHegvold
Reviews.Content: This was a well-maintained, freshly remodeled place with large rooms and queen beds. The breakfast was good and the price was great. I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A poor experience.”
Reviews.Author: hback
Reviews.Content: We had a poor experience at this hotel. Very disorganized and delayed check-in, inadequate room air conditioning and a deceptive " breakfast not included " pricing policy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: LSB85
Reviews.Content: Was only here for one night unfortunaly. We were origionaly staying with friends until my friend had a fight with one of their family members so we stayed here. Room is lovely, spacious and modern. Didnt really use much of the facilities but walked around the grounds and it was nice. Went to a diner oppsite which was wickid and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, 4 star looks! But disorganized staff.”
Reviews.Author: seplin2003
Reviews.Content: We had a 15 hour layover in Miami so decided to get a room for the day. My friend was feeling ill and grumpy so when we got to the hotel at 6:30am and was told there were no rooms in my category available yet, he was none to happy. The clerk was looking at his computer for a couple of minutes and tells us nicely sorry, but he can't force anyone to check-out. We're like duh, we know that. So we went to eat the breakfast in the hotel as he suggested. When we tried to get seated, the hostess asks us what room number so we told her we're still waiting to check-in. She says, the only way to charge for the breakfast is to the room. I go back to the front desk and he apologizes and says that they just switched to a new system and gives me 2 cards with our registration information. I hand the hostess the cards and we get seated. Now the waiter asks us which room we're in and again, we tell him, we're waiting to check-in and we gave the hostess our registration information. There's 4 choices to choose from, continental buffet, continental, american, and I forget the last one. We order the non-buffet breakfasts and he tells us to get our choices from the buffet which is organized awkwardly. When we're ready to leave the waiter asks us do we want the breakfast charged to our room or pay now. We're like WTH, we were told we can't pay here. He says, no we can pay now. Ugh! He disappears for 10-15 minutes with my credit card. We're thinking, did he go shopping? But we see him at the bar probably trying to figure out how to charge the card. We tried to eat slowly but my friend didn't have much of an appetite so I go back to the front desk and ask him can we maybe upgrade the room to something that is ready. His supervisor is now there and she says sure and then while they were looking at the screen, she asks, do you have to have 2 beds? I'm like no, as long as it's a king or queen, 1 is fine. She tells the clerk, just give them the king, it's the same price. I'm again like WTH! He saw and heard my friend was feeling sick, he couldn't suggest that option? The room is beautiful. Fully loaded and really clean and modern. It even had a stainless steel microwave. The bathroom was just as nice with granite counters and good lighting in the shower with recessed lights overhead. I hate when hotel showers have that thick opaque curtain and the only lighting is in the vanity so inside the shower, it's so dark. The air-conditioner was quiet and efficient, the bed super comfy. The only thing wrong with the room was instead of shampoo and conditioner, there were 2 conditioners so when we showered, we had to use soap to shampoo our hair. We were too tired to bother calling anyone about it. So very good for the room and a 3 star for the staff. I hope they work out the kinks in their new system for the staff. I just got my credit card bill and they billed me for my room plus 13% tax and $23.62 for an $18.00 breakfast. That's like 32% tax! I'm going to email them and lets see what happens.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ayekyi
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. The hotel is fairly new complex, large rooms, nice bathroom with amenities. Although we did find 1 bed bug and killed it (this would be the only negative). Make sure you inspect the bed sheets in every hotel you stay. Breakfast was awesome, good variety. The decor of the hotel is modern. Location is close to airport so if you are planning to stay in miami for a while, you might be spending alot of money on taxi. I thought the hotel was a great value for the price we payed. We stayed in 3 different hotels while we were in miami and this was the best by far.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMGBarcelona
Reviews.Content: The hotel is almost brand new so rooms and facilities are spotless. Rooms a spacious and well furnished and if you are lucky views can be spectacular. It is five minutes drive from airport and twenty from downtown MIami. The area is just OK but you do not go to this hotel to visit the area. My only suggest is about breakfast. The breakfast area is not big and gets very busy, the offer is enough but just enough and the stop serving too early.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: corlett c
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a fantastic hotel. We called 15 minutes before normal checkout time to request late checkout and they let us do it. The room was beautiful, the view was beautiful, and overall the hotel was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Khirstin
Reviews.Content: I've been to a billion hotels. I've also been to a billion resorts. This has got to be the best hotel I've been to and also competes with some extremely expensive resorts I've stood at around the world. Now that's saying something. Service is great, beds are amazing, washrooms are huge, rooms are so clean and tidy, staff is so nice and helpful, and if you get a room on a particular side of the hotel you get a great view of the city. It's not too expensive of a place and the location is fantastic. It's good for short stays and medium stays as the room is quite big and doesn't feel claustrophobic. I'm very happy I stood here and I will always come back.

Reviews.Title: “SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO FOR A MOTEL WITH BETTER SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Aleeen
Reviews.Content: Honestly the main reason I made an account for TripAdvisor was to tell people to not go HERE. Within one day I managed to get moved 4 times with an employee following me to each and every room so we can inspect it, because there rooms are DISGUSTING. One had a used VASELINE with hairs all over it under the couch and a wet carpet from the AC. The front desk tells me "Oh they probably forgot it" and "It's wet from the rain" whatever that means. The 2nd room had white crusted stains on the brown bed cover and the employee tells me "I can change it if you want" IF I WANT? then he says in a childish manner "somebody was having lots of fun here" and starts giggling like a little boy. The 3rd room as soon as I walked in, I ducked down to see garbage under the couch again so i walked out to look no further and requested another room. The 5% fluent employee going up and down with us from front desk to room from front desk to room can't say more then "WOW THIS NO CLEAN". The 4th room once again has garbage under the couch this time pennies/nickels/dimes and candy wrappers and under the chair cushion there is a handful of bread crumbs and chewed pieces of salami which hasn't been vacuumed up probably in a long time. Walk down the hall to see a housekeeping with her shoes off and laying on the bed relaxing while talking on her cell phone. ARE YOU SERIOUS?

Reviews.Title: “1 Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: napkat
Reviews.Content: The hotel/room was very nice in the inside; the outside was another story - the external view was not so hot... quite disappointed... but beds were very comfy, the room was very clean and staff was very helpful.....The morining breakfast was free, don't expect too much just something to get you through until lunch....

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: liskauskas
Reviews.Content: If you need a hotel near the airport, new, convenient, clean, not expensive, Best western premier is a safe choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepness night- won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Manamaeva
Reviews.Content: The first hours I spent at the Best Western where great: nice room and friendly checking. My room however was next to the lift and had no view. Throughout the night I could hear people talking down the hallway and people upstairs walking and was seemed like dropping bags on the floor. I went down the next day with my 3 year old in my arm, trying to get some breakfast but the small area was packed-some people had to eat standing up! I did not get any help from the three employees who were going back and forth to the kitchen-only saw their backs. After a good 5 mn standing holding my kid and my plate there was a seat left. The food was nothing special and My table was littered with the breakfast of the previous guests, as well as the surrounding tables. It was quite an unpleasant way to recover from jetlag and head back again to the airport. Noisy airport + crowded breakfast area: I won't be back and found better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: lovely1_9
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and always willing to assist us in finding our way around. The food was excellent , breakfast was a great experience with a wide variety of choices. The location is great and the airport shuttle was prompt and the drivers very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 night stay at The Best Western”
Reviews.Author: ClareLouise19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western before travelling to Naples.Great facilities and felt very safe.On site car park.Small pool to relax and have a drink after long journey with waiter service.Ate in the restaurant at night which was fine.The breakfast was welcoming after a good nights sleep but I would recommend you get there early as it's a small area.Reception very helpful and efficient.Would definately recommend as somewhere to put your head for the night before exploring Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, crowded breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeAlbuquerque
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel if your are planing on staying near the airport. Rooms are new and spacious and so is the bathroom. The neigborhood is not very nice but is very close to the airport. The one thing that was very disapointing was the breakfast. Hours are from 6-9AM and by 8:15 its so crowded that we had to eat while standing up. Front desk personel were very helpfull and there is a shuttle that can take you to the airport every half hour free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: JinLiAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the good reviews on tripadvisor. I was not disappointed; nice clean rooms, good shuttle service from the airport and a day later to the rental car facility near the airport and last but not least the nice breakfast buffet service which is included in the price. Furthermore there is even a swimming pool although not for a long stay as it is just along very busy roads.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and convenient!!”
Reviews.Author: patty_montandon
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 days before to return to our country, the hotel is super clean and very confortable beds, a 42'' TV Plasma in rooms, very quite and great hospitality. the chef cooks excellent!! The rooms are new and everything works perfect. The location is not the best but is near of many stores, airport and many places to visit. We enjoyed a lot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hassle-free connection to the airport”
Reviews.Author: snelj10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had an early flight the following day, 6:30AM to be specific. The free shuttle service got us to the airport at 5:10 AM with plenty of time to get checked in and boarded. We did not get to use the hotel amenities but the room was clean with a comfortable bed. This is a great option for anyone in a similar situation of having an early flight out the next day. My only complaint is the slow service at the front desk... The staff forgot to return my credit card and never offered to deliver it upstairs to me. I had to go downstairs to get it myself...

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Pool Next to Busy street”
Reviews.Author: FamOnTheGO-4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and clean great for a one night stay near the airport. Hot breakfast is great and the coffee is exceptional.
