Only problem was that the pool is next to a very busy street and the cars are roaring by. The attitute of some of the hotel staff was poor. I asked the gent for a box of kleenex as mine had run out, never got them. Some others seemed quite snobbly. I was quoted a different rate base on who I talked to when extending for another day. The hotel was quite noisy and you could hear into the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: dusnie
Reviews.Content: We booked a double bed room and got a suite. It was fantastic. The most gorgeous room we've had so far. The bed slept very well and the bathroom was awsome. Good breakfast, too bad ther's an occupancy foor 66 people and many guests had to wait for a seat that morning. However, breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good but little niggles”
Reviews.Author: Bob-a-JobSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night prior to an onward flight to Costa Rica. Check in was good and the room was nice and modern. We slept well and the breakfast was acceptable for this grade of hotel. It was a shame a few niggles spoilt our experience here. Both the toilet paper and paper tissues were in short supply, there were toiletries but no shampoo only conditioner and body lotion. We phoned housekeeping and shampoo and toilet paper were brought up within 10 minutes. The bedside lamp did not work, the coffee table was dirty and the corner of the bed unmade and generally the room and bathroom cleanliness was a little below par. This is a nice modern hotel much better than other Miami airport hotels we have tried, such a shame the housekeeping let it down. We would stay here again hoping management take note of reviews.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetennis
Reviews.Content: I cannot express PLEASED I was to happen upon this gem:) Needed a hotel one night because connecting flight was early the next day. the Best Western Premiere was brand new (8 monhts old) super clean, very Euro in style and the staff gets an A++. Do NOT stay anywhere else...I paid $89 on hotwire...no way will I ever stay elsewhere when coming in for one night/heading out early the next day in MIA. The pool was great.. salt water. my kids were able to swim. The only thing I did not like was the pizza we ordered from Gio's..They are not part of the hotel but they deliver there. Go to Pizza hut. Gio's delivered the WRONG pizza 2 sizes too small and took my 13 yr old son's cash for it anyways even when he said it wasn't the correct pizza. They did come back with another pizza about 45 min later (first one was 1 hr) but the pizza generally was just bland and PAPER THIN. yuck. The hotel food, however was fine. I did not eat at the restraunt but the Free breakfast in the a.m..was all really very decent for being FREE!!! Bagels/muffins were fresh, good selection of cereal/juices etc. They had hot foods but we were there too early so just snacked on the cold stuff. Opens 6am.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it and will return when ever we in Miami”
Reviews.Author: honeymooninmiami
Reviews.Content: From the time we got to the hotel, the staff took great pride in providing us with the highest level of professional service and hospitality. When ever we return to Miami this will always be our place of choice. The rooms are wonderful. The food was great and there is always someone to meet you at the door whenever you go or come. Thanks for letting our honeymoon stay great, I would recommend this hotel a thousand times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Cornelljh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and modern. It's located near a Pizza Hut, Burger King and a few other local restaurants. The restaurant on the property is okay. Breakfast in the morning was very good. However, they did not have everything to prepare items on the dinner/desert menu. Check in and check out was very fast and easy. For some reason, our room did not have a tv remote and we asked for one, but never received it. The room itself was very nice. Nice flat screen tv and a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: beachperls
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel. So it was clean and very good. The room was very fashionable with two queen beds and a big LCD TV. The bathroom was roomy and very good. Corridors were as well new and clean. Lobby had a sofa arrangement good for waiting, but nothing outside the extra. Breakfast was good in a nice fashionable setting. I wouldnâ€™t pay extra for the breakfast. But for being included it offer even more than I expected. Also staff around was very kind and helpful. The pool is good for a quick dip or fun for kids. Unfortunately the pool is located next to a busy street; hence some noise from the cars. At lease there is a good fence, so it is only the noise that is disturbing. Arguably when swimming it will not be an issue at all. Parking is fine but possible a tick small for this big hotel. But the â€œfree of chargeâ€� is of course unbeatable in this area. Be aware that the reception desk is understaffed and a line can very quickly build up. Having said that the reception was very friendly. We paid an introduction rate, which was good price performance for this area of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: lisathomascollins
Reviews.Content: We drove around Miami searching for a place to stay to our satisfaction. We are loyal Best Western customers so when we saw this one we were excited. The suites are wonderful and very roomy. Excellent breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Definately our hotel of choice for our Miami shopping trips!”
Reviews.Author: TriniEljay
Reviews.Content: Had a great time! The ONLY issue we had during our stay was the face that one of the two elevators was out of service for five out of the seven days; mind you, we saw the technicians on two occations trying to fix the non functional one, but I guess it involved something serious. Other than that everything was just perfect. Staff at front desk were friendly and professional. Bed was so comfortable! Room was kept spotless even with all the shopping we did.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and frustrating”
Reviews.Author: PM52
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel partially because of TripAdvisor reviews, and because they have a restaurant on site. However, we found the restaurant highly disappointing and frustrating. We were two couples. Tried to order an appetizer initially, but were told they did not have that available. The waiter (who was obviously inexperienced and not knowledgeable of the restaurant, its policies, etc) then informed us that some of the menu items were not available, either. One member of the party ordered a simple alcoholic drink; it was obvious that the waiter (who also was bartending) was unfamiliar with the mixology needed. We ordered main courses, and several minutes later the waiter returned to tell us that 3 of the 4 entrees ordered were not available. He was apologetic. As a result of this ongoing fiasco, we had to go elsewhere for dinner, which we had tried to avoid by staying at this hotel. The following morning we were told that the General Manager was away, and the Front Desk Manager was on the phone (apparently there is no restaurant manager). However, the desk clerk did provide a discount on the room rate for our trouble. Rooms were fine, but if you want to eat, don't stay here. Also, repeated false fire alarms occured late afternoon, with staff ignoring the hotel's written policies because they "knew there was no fire." Elavators continued to run during this period ( incidentally, only one of the 2 elevators was working while we were there, although this is a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay-good hot breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FW-GI-Joe
Reviews.Content: Clean, great breakfast, overall nice place to stay for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Best overnight stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: tan-hun
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible hotel for your money!! Delicious breakfast. Very clean. Wish there were more Best Western's like this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, low quality breakfast”
Reviews.Author: UshkoNL
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night after a 10 hour flight. The room was nice and clean, the only bad thing was the air-conditioning that was producing lots of noise. This hotel is located in a neighborhood that doesn't have lots to offer. My partner found it a bit on the creepy side (in the evening). The breakfast that came with the room was very basic and simple and of poor quality. We ended up going to the nearest Ihop. My conclusion is that this hotel is okay for a short stay but definitely not for a long holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fine modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: LVO1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty new and we had no complaints about the room and it`s facilities except some hairs on the bathroom floor from previous guest, hmm. I confirm indeed that the cleaning could be better, Also we had a toilet that we could not use (flush) anymore at 10 PM. According to the reception the guy from maintenaince was away, so we had to wait till the next morning before it could be repaired. A missed change from the reception that we were not offerered a new room.. Breakfast is simple, what can I say. Bagles, creamcheese, muffins, jus, toast, coffee/tea,yogurt and some hot potatoes. Nothing healthy to find there. Breakfast room was a bit small if all guest would pop-up at the same time. Spanish lady working in the breakfast area when we were there was not very enthusiast or friendly. Reception was overall friendly. Pool area was ok, inside the hotel on the ground floor a small gym and the hotel has two elevators. There is free parking and free WIFI. Area around the hotel was not very special. A Shell station on the corner of the nearby street and a Burger King. No "normal" restaurants nearby. We didn`t use the hotel restaurant. We drove to Coral Gables one night which is about 15 to 20 minutes from the hotel. Strange thing is that every night we found about 3 to 5 pizza flyers in our room. Obviously everyone can walk in- and out of the hotel? Perhaps because there are two entrances. Hotel manager, improve the security level in your hotel! Or is the reception perhaps paid to allow the distribution of these flyers? Bottomline a fine airport hotel for me. but nothing fancy. Somehwat overpriced and for sure not 4 star. Housing keeping and security should be better.

Reviews.Title: “Severly lacking customer service”
Reviews.Author: SunTravelz
Reviews.Content: We arrived for one night prior to a cruise. We checked into 2 rooms and then headed to the restaurant for dinner. The menu was too fancy...we just wanted a sandwich or salad and the menu had full entrees like salmon, steaks and chops. The waiter was not trained and he had a hard time taking our order. We ordered 2 garden salads and 2 caesar salads. He asked what kind of dressing we wanted and when we asked what they had, he said only Ranch. Then, he asked what kind of dressing we wanted on the caesar salads. The funny thing was when the salads arrived, he now said they had NO ranch and we would need to get Blue Cheese or House. We wanted appetizers so he read us the menu from his bar computer. (there were no appetizer menus printed up) We got a small ice cream dish of tortilla chips (maybe 10 chips in each) and a condiment cup (1 Tablespoon) filled with guacamole and when we got the bill, it was $3.95 for the chips and $2.00 for each cup of guacamole. He did tell us he would refill the chips and we did have him do that, only to find that when he returned, he had emptied the crushed bottom-of-the-bag chips into the bowl and the pieces were too small to even dip in the guacamole. It was like chip confetti. The weird thing about this restaurant was the kitchen area. When an order was ready, the cook opened a door and rang a bell. The waiter then went and got our salads, one by one, and delivered them to the table. We had to ask for silverware and there were no salt and pepper on any table. The place was extremely quiet and I kept thinking if they had a more casual menu with decent prices and trained staff, it would have been more busy. The hotel is in an area where there are not restaurants to walk to unless you want Burger King. The next morning, one of our rooms discovered they had no washcloths. The front desk said they would call housekeeping and have them bring some up. 20 min later, still nothing. So, we called again and he said he would call housekeeping again. 4 hours later when we checked out we still had not gotten washcloths.

Reviews.Title: “Not so 4-Star...”
Reviews.Author: demarcost
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April on a pleasure trip to Miami. I was able to get what I thought was a pretty good deal on a room as compared to, for instance, Hyatt Miami at the Blue. The rooms were comfortable enough, but most everything else left something to be desired. I wouldn't have minded the cramped breakfast area if the food was actually decent. Instead when we went down on a Sunday morning (when you'd expect many guests might take advantage of the breakfast - and were) my bagel was VERY stale and we're fairly certain the eggs were fake. One of the most disturbing things was the lack of security. Every day we were there, without exception, there were anywhere from 3-5 menus from local pizza restaurants shoved under our door. It made us feel very insecure that these non-guests non-hotel-employees were apparently given free reign to walk around and deliver their menus. We have never experienced this at any other hotel. One day we were actually in the room and when one such flyer was delivered we heard someone actually check the door to see if it would open. The bad breakfast I can handle but the bad security was enough to make me never stay there again. By the way, you might want to make sure you stay on a floor that actually has an ice machine unless you want to take a little trip each time you'd like some ice.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Pleasant and RELAXING Experience. EXCELLENT Promotional Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: bcbgpro
Reviews.Content: This particular Best Western Premier was very relaxing to stay there. It had a beautiful color scheme of soft, celestial lime/sage greens all over the hotel with accents of natural moist wood browns and natural bright whites. The mattresses were so noticeably comfortable and pleasant. The big flat screen televisions were a great joy to have in the room. The towels are plush and would like for the cleaning staff to provide more for the rooms, speaking of face cloths in particular but it was great to stay there anyway. The chandelier in the lobby is EXCELLENT as a greeting to the hotel. Has washing and laundry rooms which is a great amenity. Easy access to many locations in and around the area of Miami. Fun to come home to the hotel just down the street from the Publix grocery store. Also, has an ice cream parlor and Burger King in close proximity. Parking is miniscule but we managed to find spaces all the time. The hotel staff is extremely professional and friendly which makes it a plus! The staff took care of any and all issues we had concerning our stay there and also helped with local addresses and suggestions/directions with excellent results. Day and Night staff were all helpful. They all speak to you when you arrive and greet you goodbye. The Kitchen server staff during the breakfast hours were so unexpectedly helpful when they informed me in a busy and sincere rush that there will be more eggs coming soon. I didn't even ask, but appreciated it very much. There was lots of a genuine feeling care of atmosphere here. Would come back!

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the Bed bugs too”
Reviews.Author: vaaas
Reviews.Content: This is unbelievable. I have three little kids including an infant. Based on the Star rating and location, we checked into Best Western Premier Miami International Airport Hotel & Suites which is newly built 4-Star hotel. Around midnight, as i was adjusting my 6 month olds sheet, i saw a bed bug right under her sheet. Also found a huge one running on the headboard. My kids were in deep sleep and as such they have nightmares about bugs i didn't want to wake them up and scare them. Lost my sleep and was constantly pulling the sheets to check for Bed Bugs. I caught one of the Bed Bugs to show it to the Hotel front desk staff and as evidence (You wouldnâ€™t believe its still alive with no food in the plastic bag). Also, took a video of the bug that was running around the bed. Next morning, i made a compliant to the front desk Manager; he refunded the money for the room with no questions asked. I wonder if they're already aware of this issue. I also booked another room for my parents. As they are old and really tired after walking around the downtown area, they never checked for Bed Bugs in their room but I found some in their room as well. If i could find couple in my room, Iâ€™m sure the whole floor is infested. As i paid 400 some dollars for a night for this hotel never realized i would be paying for this filthy disgusting bed bugs too. I'm in the process of filing a complaint with the Health County Department. PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice at all.”
Reviews.Author: MaxNg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the hotel and it was very nice and pleasant. Good location, 10min from best places by car medium time. The hotel is brand new, with confortable rooms, good and free wifi internet, good cleaning and equipment. The breakfast was the only bad point. Few food for much people, but most part we prefer to have it outside. Parking lot is not so big, if you arrive late at night, you'll probably find few available spaces. Overall is a good hotel and a Nice place to stay with a helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: gnewbill
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Rooms are very nice and clean & roomy! Breakfast was good...nice to see it was not the bland "continetal" type. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would stay there again. Also...not to far from south beach (15mins)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and disturbing level of cleanliness, but great location”
Reviews.Author: baldtomato
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a post-cruise 2-night stay at this hotel, and despite being tired and sick, I couldn't wait to write up a review as a warning to you all. I booked this hotel based on its location, modern decor, free parking, and most importantly, good reviews, and came out very disappointed. For a family of 4, we booked a suite (instead of a regular 2-Queen bed room) hoping there's at least a tiny bit of privacy as there is usually a partitioned "bedroom" in "suites" - but it turns out the "suite" in this hotel is just a slightly elongated room with the King bed "partitioned" by a ONE foot long frosted glass pane that blocks view of the pillows from the sofabed... NOT a "suite" as all. We arrived early at noon and there was a VERY long line of people checking out, with only one counter person working, however, the other side of the counter (not yet staffed) has a sign that says "check in" so we lined up there (behind another couple) to wait for a staff person. When that staff person finally arrived 20 minutes later (the check-out line up had barely moved), she rudely told us to get back in line. We said we are checking in and everyone else in the lobby was checking out, and she just said, "get in line". Well, I thought it was rude. I mean, why bother putting a sign up if both counters are intended to serve one general line up? At least they gave us our room early, and we stayed in there till about 3 pm as my kids take a nap, which might explain my next mishap. We passed by the counter on our way out for dinner, and as we had missed the regular housekeeping hours, i just simply requested the front desk to please get someone to empty our trashcans (full from my kids eating snacks and opening packages in the room). They acknowledged us but when we returned, it was NOT done. We shrugged and readied ourselves for bedtime... only to notice that the sofabed had NO bedding. No extra pillows no sheets and for the 4 of us (we paid for 4 people at reservation) we only got 3 pillows and 2 bath towels. It was 10 pm so we called down to front desk, and he said there was NOTHING that could be done. So i said... how are we supposed to sleep... on the dirty uncovered sofabed mattress? I would not relent, and only then that the front desk guy came up with one thin flat sheet and told us that's all he could find. I asked if he could put it onto the bed for us and he said NO! So there I was, exhausted from a long day and making the bed myself in a hotel.... and out of the corner of my eye we saw a pair of underwear by the armchair that definitely did not belong to us! The next day, I told the daytime front desk people about the sofa bedding fiasco and the pair of DIRTY UNDERWEAR found in our room, she made an "ew" face and wrote it down on paper, but there's nothing after... no apologies no nothing. In the 2nd evening after we parked, I noticed the other cars had parking placards and we were never asked if we needed one, so i went up to the front counter (same rude man from the bedding fiasco) and he *very* impatiently said, "oh well it's not like i have time to tow you" and grumpily wrote up a placard.... Decor is modern, breakfast buffet was VERY crowded on the Monday morning but was great on Tuesday, and free parking was a plus. The room has a microwave and an empty bar fridge which helped, but no hot water kettle (only a coffee maker). The furniture is FULL of sharp edges and corners (more than usual) perhaps due to its modern decor so it's not too toddler-friendly.... The location was good (minutes to car rental return at MIA airport with lots of gas stations along the way, 15 minutes to midtown, 20-25 minutes to Coral Gables and 35 minutes to Zoo Miami) BUT all that aside, the dirty underwear and bedding fiasco had really scared me. I think I would stick to Courtyard by Marriott next time for a pre/post cruise stay.....

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: AuditorUk
Reviews.Content: Only used this hotel for one night straight off a trans atlantic flight but what a hotel. The rooms were large and the beds the most comfortable I have slept in for some time. Although in the city and close to the airport it was quiet in the hotel and room. The inclusive breakfast was excellent and the staff couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel next to airport”
Reviews.Author: takers77
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night with the MIami Airport Hotel. It was ok... I wouldn't suggest it to a friend. Bad customer service, and the rooms were on the older side. On the way back through Miami I got stuck at the Miami Airport. I was going to stay at the Airport Hotel again, but Ameircan airlines got me a room with Best Western PREMIER (I put Premier in CAPS for a reason!). I read a review from tripadvisor and decided to give them a shot. The hotel has been around for 5 months, so it is very new. I'm not sure if I was upgraded, but I got the King suite. It was incredible... I don't see rooms like that in a 5 star hotel. I need to check the Best Western site to see if this is their attempt to compete with some of the "Hilton's" of the world. Regardless, it was a great hotel room. The service was great as well, since several of the folks in line were agitated flyers that were stuck in Miami. For whatever reason they only had one gentleman at the front desk, and he patiently worked his way though the line. My only issue was I didn't feel like you had a lot to walk to around the hotel. I ordered pizza for dinner. They have "something like a restaurant" downstairs but it closes promptly at 10p.

Reviews.Title: “Very new and well located”
Reviews.Author: Mottinha_Anna
Reviews.Content: This is a Best Western Hotel, so it keeps best western quality standard: modern furniture, comfortable and large room. And everything there is very new. The location is very good if you have a car as it is easy to reach the major roads, specially Dolphin Expressway. From the hotel, you quickly reach many places within 15 min drive. The only thing we didn't like was the breakfast room: it was too small for the number of guests and, as the breakfast ends at 9.00 a.m. it concentrates a large number of guests at the same time. So, you always have to stand in line to take your food and, for me that was looking for relaxing, it wasn't a good experience. Anyway, apart from this breakfast issue, i'd really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Divagal275
Reviews.Content: We got a great introductory price deal on their suite. The hotel is nice clean, trendy, and the suite was very comfortable for us.

Reviews.Title: “The "Best" Best Western We've Every Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: TXLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 separate times at this Best Western (last week and this week) enroute to/from the Virgin Islands. This Best Western pulled out all of the stops when building this relatively new hotel - I wish they were all like this one! Friendly staff, beautifully decorated, very comfortable beds and pillows, clean, quiet, good breakfast, will let you leave your vehicle parked there for I believe it was $6/day; free shuttle to/from airport. They have nice thick towels, great showers and a laundry room - it's so comfortable and I believe 100% non-smoking, which is a big plus since I have bad allergies. Decent price of of $111 (AAA discount plus tax). A lot better deal than many of the more expensive hotels. Give this one a try - I don't think you will be disappointed at all. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay before cruise.”
Reviews.Author: MWMS58
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Miami airport late the night before a cruise. I had booked this motel online and had the number of the motel in hand, which was a good thing, because I called the front desk several times. The first time was to alert them that we needed the shuttle and to find out where to catch it.--From the baggage carousel, go up to level two. There is a waiting area for all hotel shuttles. I know all shuttles pick-up here because I watched them all go by again and again. After waiting for 30 minutes, I phoned again. "Fifteen minutes", I was told. We waited another 30 minutes. Thank goodness it was a pleasant evening although it is under cover should it have been raining. I had just called to check on it again, when it arrived."Engine trouble" was the excuse but it sounded fine to us, but it was free and now we were on our way. The hotel is new with contemporary decor. Our room was large, clean and comfortable. We told the desk that we needed a ride to the port in the morning and he put us on a list. We had three choices for pick-up times. The hotel has arranged a shuttle service for $10 pp. The van was there early and the driver was very organized in order to get us all to our particular cruise ship. He also took reservations via a receipt for a $5 deposit and our phone number for the return trip from port to the airport. We initially agreed and paid, but when he said he would be there at 9am, we decided against it because we had an early flight. (On our way to the airport in a cab, he called to tell us it was 9am and he was waiting for us, which was nice. He had forgotten we had canceled.) We arrived too late to eat at the hotel.The restaurant/bar area was closed. They did have some snacks for sale near the front desk and there is a Burger King across the street, but we opted to walk to the corner gas station for snacks and drinks to eat in the room. The complimentary breakfast was not exceptional but they did have some hot and cold choices. The seating area was very crowded. All in all, a great place to stay the night before a cruise. Just be prepared to wait on the shuttle or pay for a cab.

Reviews.Title: “confortable”
Reviews.Author: Ahsieh77
Reviews.Content: clean & confortable room, suitable for any business trip....

Reviews.Title: “Brand new-sparkling clean”
Reviews.Author: airedaleluva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night between cruise and flying home. it was close to the airport with free, reliable shuttle service. Hotel super new, clean, nice rooms with a very good free breakfast. Even the shuttle bus was new. The "business center" had 2 state-of-art computers for travelers use. The staff was very helpful. Pool was small. The location was not great but I would recommend to travelers needing to get to airport. Modern styling Best Western-very nice decor.

Reviews.Title: “First time...not bad!”
Reviews.Author: AnchorageAweigh
Reviews.Content: It was our first time staying here. We have appreciated all of the other reviews. We got an incredible deal as a grand opening special for a gorgeous suite. Lots of room, granite, 2 sink areas, fridge, microwave, etc. The furniture is nice and sleeping was very comfortable. The front desk staff was very helpful and called us to see if our room was good for us. There was some loud generator just across from our room, but it wasn't a problem with the door shut. We do agree with others that the rooms are not quiet. We heard people making noise late into the night, along with a domestic downstairs in the parking lot. We turned on the AC, which solved the problem. The food at their restaurant wasn't great, but we were only there to spend a night while traveling. We ate at the bar and had a fun conversation with the bartenders. The only issues were that they only had 2 computers at the business center to print boarding passes. They did let us use the computer behind the front desk to print them. Shuttle service was also good as there at least 20 seats available for guests. We have stayed at quite a few different MIA airport hotels, and we liked this one the best!

Reviews.Title: “Was worried for no reason!”
Reviews.Author: jezebell91
Reviews.Content: I can understand how people could complain about little things here and there, but this was a great place all around. The rooms were VERY clean and Andre was very helpful with everything we needed, and he was just generally friendly. We originally booked 3 nights but we ended up needing to extend for a night. This was no problem and we still got a decent rate for our fourth night even though it was last minute! Most hotels will not let you extend your stay once you get there without moving you to a different room or charging you the highest rate. This was not the case here. I would like to see combination safes installed in the rooms, but other than that I couldn't have asked for more. We loved hanging out by the pool in the smoking area at night where we can see all the night lights. We will definitely stay here again whether it's for business or leisure, this has to be one of the nicest Best Westerns I've ever seen. I was worried because it was one of the cheaper hotels, but it turned out to be awesome. I am big on things being clean and I actually had no complaints here! Love this place, if you are looking for a good deal and a stylish, comfortable place, you'll find it here! :-) And the free parking made it awesome, most hotels charge 20 dollars a day for that in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and convenient new hotel”
Reviews.Author: j_p_faranda
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel--not a remodel--is stylish and comfortable. The large rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The shuttle service was convenient and easy. The surround neighborhood isn't great, and the lobby restaurant is limited, but this is a quiet hotel far enough away from the airport to avoid the noise of the planes while still being close enough to be convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenn0873
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight before leaving on a cruise. Free airport shuttle, very timely manner. Quick, friendly check-in. Very clean hotel. Only issue--very small breakfast area. Very congested and not alot of seating. Transportation to the port-$10 pp- very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the price range”
Reviews.Author: mvarella
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights in the beginning of February after my international plane landed. The location is great, it is really close to the airport with lots of restaurants nearby. The room is very good as the amenities are. The bed and TV are higher than average if compared to other hotels at this price. The breakfast has hot and cold options. It is enough to get started and not a feast. The staff is up par. The wi-fi works great. Felt so good that I made another reservation for my return in the end of February before I took the plane back. For lows $100 I don't think I could find any better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Brand New Modern Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: angelwings79
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find a good hotel less than $200 in Miami before our cruise but got lucky when we stumbled upon the Best Western Premier online for a great price. We stayed here for 2 nights and would highly recommend it. The free airport shuttle is so convenient as well as free wifi, breakfast and parking. The hotel is brand new and very tastefully decorated - very unlike the typical best western style and feels distinctly 'un-budget' rather quite luxurious with modern minimalist decor. The room was very big with huge kingsize, very comfortable bed and widescreen tv. Overall a very postive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not Premier category”
Reviews.Author: MiguelRamirez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, new and has a good location near the airport. We used it to spend the night before going on a cruise ship. As usual in most BW hotels, free Internet (wireless). On the down side: BW Premier means that they should have in-room safety boxes, but there were none. The breakfast was bad according to our standards, but maybe good acording to american standards where you usually get a doughnut and coffee for breakfast. This breakfast buffet was tiny and people where walking into one another. We missed the salad that we usually get in BW Italy hotels. Our fridge, beside being new, made a lot of noise from time to time. All in all it was a good hotel, but I would not label it Premier.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: nymike_11
Reviews.Content: I was recently married on a cruise out of Miami and chose this hotel for all of my guests to stay at prior to leaving for the cruise. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was very friendly. I've never had a better night's sleep, the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: jcp75211
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful as business hotels go. Nicer than a Hyatt Place or an Aloft. Unfortunately the service was terrible. When I checked in the desk clerk did not know what Best Western rewards were. When I returned from work at 4:45 pm on the first day my room was not serviced. I called down to the front desk and let them know. The response was that housekeeping was busy. I stopped down at 5:45 and had another clerk add my Rewards number I mentioned it again and I further mentioned that all I really wanted was a towel refresh, I returned at 745 and nothing. I called downstairs and was told they brought towels and that I should check again. There were no towels. Additionally there was no manager on duty. I went down in the morning and the front desk clerk was very helpful. He mentioned that I should speak to the manager which I did. The manager seemed rather nonplussed by the whole thing. I did return that evening and the room had been refreshed. The only issue is that there was long black hair in the tub (I do not have long black hair). The plusses: Beautiful, great TV and channel selection, good internet connections.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with growing pains”
Reviews.Author: elgringo18
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel, chosen for its location over anything else. I was told the shuttle ran very half hour, but after waiting 45 minutes at MIA I called and was told the driver was just leaving. He made no effort to help with luiggage, although very other hotel's shuttle driver (I wacthed tons go by while waiting) did so. The front desk staff were SUPER courteous and helpful. I had dinner at the hotel restaurant for convenience. Really good food, but the one server was busy talking with a friend of his at the bar and really had no time for guests, of which there were only six in the whole place. The chef came out more often than the waiter, but was schmozing with two guests at another table. When my food came out, he came over and grilled me on the food. Really, I felt like I was being interrogated, and his big smile foir the old couple at the other table had disappeared. "And the sauce?! How is the sauce?!" He's a great chef but maybe needs to stay in the kitchen. Breakfast was a nightmare. The layout is bad for an overcrowded sitting, and guests were sort of fighting to get food. Coffee is far from sugar and cream (of which there was none, a harried and incourteous staff member told me). Rooms were very nice and clean, but to echo other reviewers, walls are paper thin. You can see that management is trying, and this will hopefully be a good place all around once they come together as a team. And really, these were all minor annoyances individually, but taken all together, I can only give this place three stars.

Reviews.Title: “very nice,truly new and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: irina55
Reviews.Content: We used to travel a lot and stay in very good and fancy hotels in Europe,but since i stopped working in order to stay home with our two little ones,we are financially cautious. This hotel is definitely not your average "best western". New and modern, which is hard to find in Miami for decent $. Most of the so called "new" hotels are old ones with minor cosmetic updates (like new mattresses). We had a beautiful contemporary suite,very spacious, with mini fridge, coffee maker,flat tv, king size bed and pull out sofa. I booked it on best western website."grand opening special" rate plan gave the best price ($144/night including all taxes and breakfast.parking is free!) . it also offers a free shuttle to the airport. we stayed in the hotel for one night after the cruise and were taking an early flight home. Rented a car for the day to go to "Jungle island" (perfect for our 2 and 3 year old) and for a very nice ride and walk to a Crandon Park in Key Biscayne. Would definitely recommend this hotel, unless you are planning to spend the whole time in Miami beach.I spent days searching for a good hotel in Miami (turned out to be the hardest task ever), so i hope to save somebody a headache with my review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ange100
Reviews.Content: We stay here it was a shopping trip/ vacation trip. Verry nice, clean Hotel!! The people are really nice and the service was great. one thing the restaurant has not many seats zo you need to get up urly to have a good breakfast and a nice seat!! One thing missing is a save deposit to keep you things save!! Location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: COsses1125
Reviews.Content: People have a choice where to stay, DO NOT STAY HERE! My family and I stayed 5 nights and on our last night, while we were away, someone broke into our rooms and stole about $3000 dollars worth of electronics, jewelry and other items. Management and the owners have not take action nor responsibility on this matter. It looks like a tool was used to pry our doors open and gain entry. Worst experience ever. If you want to get robbed, go ahead stay at this horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel having growing pains and rooms are NOT quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Marauder11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for work in January 2011. Arrived at noon and was told that check-in couldn't happen until 3 pm. Didn't get my room until 3:30 pm. No shampoo in bathroom. Adjoining door to next room made even quiet conversations in next room sound like they were taking place in my own room. Desk staff called my room at 5 pm to tell me my shuttle was ready (ummmm...I didn't order a shuttle). Spouse called the hotel that evening and was told by staff that they didn't have me listed as staying there...ten minutes on hold later - call was put through to my room. Website lists complimentary breakfast however no staff made mention of this during check-in or at any other point during the stay. The place has potential (outdoor pool, free business centre computers, good exercise room, close to airport) and I can understand the growing pains for a new hotel with new staff however I stay at a hotel to get rest and the rooms allow far too much noise (even just normal conversations) from adjoining rooms and hallways. Wouldn't stay here again unless they could make the place quieter.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Just_Ask_O
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but great things to say about this property. It's clean, conveniently located close to the Airport, not too far away from major shopping malls or Downtown Miami, and everything in the property is brand new I recommend staying in the suites as they are more spacious and comfortable. I absolutely LOVED the pillows and bed I slept in - had the best sleep in a very long time. Also, the hotel offers complimentary Airport Shuttle, Breakfast, and High Speed Internet. My only complaint is that Breakfast ends early (6-9am), would be nice if breakfast was available for an hour longer. Also, the hotel should consider having more than one person at the Front Desk more often to decrease longer than average waits. However, all Front Desk Staff were pleasant and very helpful I stayed for 3 nights and would stay again in a heartbeat when in Miami for a short stay Email me if you have any questions

Reviews.Title: “It is a good and brand new hotel near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: LuizAlf
Reviews.Content: After a night flight to Miami, I couldnâ€™t drive to Orlando. So, I stayed in this hotel only to sleep. It is a brand new hotel. So, everything works perfect well. The room is comfortable (could be a little bigger), very tidy and very clean. The hotel hasnâ€™t got all the facilities that a Miami hotel has. But, I am certain that all the people who choose to stay in a hotel near the airport donâ€™t need the facilities of a standard hotel. In fact, the people that I talked to were there waiting for a flight or for a cruise. The breakfast was okay, except for the fact that in some periods the restaurant is completely full. The only thing that I have to complain about is the front desk. As a matter of fact, as the international flights arrive early morning, people go to the hotel expecting an early check in. The hotel has a good policy. They allow early check in as soon as they have rooms available. But, unfortunately, instead of putting the guests on a queue or write down who arrived first, they call the people in a mysterious way. It seemed to me that who keeps insisting with the front desk people is the first to be accommodated, what frankly it is the end of the world. So, apart from this, I have nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “WORSE HOTEL EXPERIENCE IN MY ENTIRE LIFE”
Reviews.Author: AnaRafaeli
Reviews.Content: I don't wish this upon my worse enemy! we had 5 rooms on the 7th floord and on the last night of our stay (tuesday checking out monday) we all went out at the same time around 7 pm. When we got back around 10:40 pm, we noticed that 3 of the rooms had been broken in! long story short: we lost about $3000 in valuables and NO ONE is taking responsability for the theft!!!! the door was pried open and we couldnt close it all the way anymore. Although police took info and checked all 3 rooms, for the hotel this means nothing. We will not be reimbursed at all,since they claim not to be liable for items left in the rooms. There is lack of customer service and absolutely no surveillance cameras in the guest floors. For a $135 + fees and taxes, this was one VERY EXPENSIVE vacation. General manager washed his hands and i will make sure that no one i know will ever go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “New Unknown Gem in Miami”
Reviews.Author: steve0701
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed 4 nights at this brand new hotel, which is located at Flagler and Le Jeune in Miami. The location is excellent, as it is central to just about everywhere in Miami and it is easily accessible. Our suite was beautiful. Very tastefully furnished with the latest electronics. My pet peeve, if you've read my previous posts, is not having access to the TV so we can plug Playstations or video players in. Not so with this place! You have complete control over the latest technology 42" LCD TV and if you want to watch the premium channels, they are all there, as well. An excellent breakfast, as well as free internet and free parking are included, so no "plus, plus, plus" as in some of the major chains. No hidden charges this way, so no surprises at check-out. If you book at this hotel, try to get on one of the higher floors, as the views are incredible. Miami is a beautiful city and all of the views are breathtaking. All-in-all, an excellent experience and I guarantee we will be staying there again in future trips to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!! Would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: akkatie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to layover one night in Miami after a cruise before flying home. I found this hotel on Orbitz, and we were thoroughly pleased. This is a relatively new hotel, and the accommodations were excellent. We took the free shuttle from the airport. Upon arriving, the front desk staff was welcoming and attentive. The rooms were clean, and the beds were extremely comfortable - the linens were top notch. We were skeptical about dinner at the hotel but didn't feel like taking a cab to a restaurant. Boy, were we happy with our decision! Compared to the cruise we had just completed, the food was definitely on par. I had the fillet and my husband had chicken parmesan. Both excellent choices. We were told the chef, Giraldo, was very good, and this proved be true. He visited our table and seemed very pleased that we were enjoying our dinner. Jose C. was a great bartender (full bar), server, and conversationalist. All in all the experience was great with one hotel drawback. We tried using the Exit to reach the first floor and found the Emergency Exit on the first floor locked on the inside. We explored other emergency routes and found none. The elevators seemed to be the only way down to the first floor. This made us extremely nervous. We mentioned this to the staff who said other guests had pointed this out too. We decided in case of fire, we'd head to the second floor, and jump out the window into the pool. Something to consider. Other than that, we truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience yet!”
Reviews.Author: urbanrv
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean, well appointed, large rooms. Very nicely decorated. Comfortable bed. Flat screen TV. We were particularly pleased that the room included a bar fridge and microwave - things which are not often found in rooms of this nature. The complimentary breakfast was varied and plentiful. The hotel also offered an extensive dinner menu. The hotel staff were very pleasant and accomodating, particularly the front desk manager who was extraordinarly helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice brand new hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Premier Miami International Airport Hotel & Suites has only been open around a year and it did have a very 'fresh' feel to it. I do not normally like to stay at Best Western since they are often rather shabby hotels but I was booking very late this time and just needed it for a night. The hotel lobby was nice and it we were quickly given our room. The front desk staff were friendly and provided us with the necessary info regarding breakfast, fitness center and business center. The room was fairly large with a nice big comfy bed. There was a large flat screen TV,desk and a comfortable chair. The bathroom was also nice and new. Coffee maker, microwave and iron was also provided. Had no trouble at all sleeping,the bed was comfortable and there was no noise at all from the road. Parking was apparently free, we did not take advantage of it since we arrived late at night (took the shuttle, was difficult to find - the airport in Miami could learn from other airports where they have designated pick-up points for each and every hotel and a map showing where these are) and picked up the rental car in the morning. The breakfast at the hotel was included in the price and it was decent. There was a selection of both hot and cold food. I would have liked some more options when it comes to bread but no real complaints. All together a great option if arriving late (or departing early).

Reviews.Title: “Great but you will ear the corridor and room next door”
Reviews.Author: bobmartin777
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel... nice but still some point to improve The good points; - Continental breakfast - Brand new, well decorated - resonnable prices The bad points - Breakfast room too small (you canot sit and the will remove everything at the minute they close... no chance to eat on saturday morning... plus no tray to bring stuff to your room when it is full) - Room was not clean carefully before the oppening... the was dust at the top of the bed, top of the tv, etc..... - The houseeeping is touching your personnal effect... example; we put our toothbrush in a glass... remove it and ut it with the soap..... I din't no really appreciate that the touch our ersonnal effect.... - We have been wake up all 4 days we spend there but people talking in the corridor.... and in room next to us....

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Contemporary Hotel Beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: Luker350
Reviews.Content: Brand new,, opened late November 2010, we stayed December 4-8 2010- great experience, fantastic morning breakfast ie. scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles, fresh fruit salad, cereal , bagels,,juices, coffee, oatmeal probably the best free morning breakfast ever!!! Staff does a great job at it. QUEEN size cozy beds, microwave and fridge area great!!!!!!!! All new furniture everywhere. Brand new coomputers and fitness center. Room has all new amenities (huge flat screen). Perfect safe area in Miami, near airport, 15 min to downtown/ beach, The hotel is absolutely spotless clean..staff all friendly (I lost my wallet in the hotel and front lobby found it and held it for me! Thank you , free parking well lit. only negatives,, pool isnot heated and in shaded area so kind of cold in December. Lots of people stay here before their cruise...I would love to stay here again!!
